thread.title: Bills safety Aaron Williams to miss at least 8 weeks after aggravating neck injury
thread.title_full: Bills safety Aaron Williams to miss at least 8 weeks after aggravating neck injury

title: Bills safety Aaron Williams to miss at least 8 weeks after aggravating neck injury
text:
Bills safety Aaron Williams to miss at least 8 weeks after aggravating neck injury THE ASSOCIATED PRESS   12:57 pmLast   12:57 pm   
People: 
New York (1742) 
ORCHARD PARK, New York — Buffalo Bills safety Aaron Williams will miss at least eight weeks because of a neck injury after being placed on the reserve-injured designated to return list. 
In making the move Wednesday, the Bills also signed free agent safety Josh Bush. Under NFL rules, Williams can return to practice in six weeks, and be eligible to play two weeks later. 
Williams missed two games after hurting his neck in a 40-32 loss to New England on Sept. 20. He briefly lost feeling in the left side of his body and was driven off the field by ambulance and taken to the hospital. 
Williams returned last weekend, but missed a few snaps after appearing to aggravate the injury in a 14-31 win at Tennessee. 
Buffalo (3-2) hosts Cincinnati (5-0) on Sunday. 
AP NFL website: http://www.pro32.ap.org and http://www.twitter.com/AP_NFL
